title: Shahzadpur Mayor Miru blamed for shot killing journalist Shimul
text:
Shahzadpur Mayor Miru blamed for shot killing journalist Shimul Senior Correspondent, bdnews24.com A video of the Thursday clash has surfaced as Shahzadpur Municipality Mayor Halimul Haque Miru finds himself increasingly being held responsible for the shooting at and killing of journalist Abdul Hakim Shimul in the presence of police. 
The mayor has also admitted to firing a shot. 
The factional feud between contending Awami League groups following an attack on a BCL leader took a nasty turn when a gunshot left Shimul injured. 
The head injury eventually cost Shimul his life on Friday while he was being transferred for better treatment to Bogra from Dhaka. 
The video shows a group being chased away by police. 
Another group then emerges from the mayor's house. At one point, a gunshot is heard and then the injured journalist is seen being carried away. 
The video shot on a mobile phone and made available to bdnews24.com captures a loud sound, which is almost accompanied by a person wondering, "One down, isn't it?" 
Another man nearby is heard saying, "Yes." 
"Is one down?" another is heard asking. It is then followed by someone relaying the events on phone, "Bullet has hit brother, yes brother yes..."
On Thursday, supporters of sacked Shahzadpur Awami League president Abdur Rahim (VP Rahim) and those of the party unit's Organising Secretary and Mayor Miru were involved in a violent skirmish. 
Daily Samakal Correspondent Abdul Hakim Shimul took a bullet in the head while covering the clash. 
He later succumbed to the injury while he was being transferred to Dhaka from Bogra on Friday afternoon. 
The autopsy report later revealed that the bullet had pierced through Shiuml's eye before making its way to the brain. 
The clashes erupted reportedly following the beating up of Shahzadpur Government College BCL President and Rahim's brother-in-law Bijoy Mahmud on Thursday afternoon. 
Shahzadpur Police Station OC Rezaul said Bijoy's uncle Ershad Ali started a case against the mayor, his two brothers Hasibul Haque Pintu, 'Mintu' and 11 others over the attack on his nephew. 
The mayor's shotgun has been seized and his two brothers have been "shown arrested." The deceased journalist's wife has also named the mayor and one of his brothers in the murder case.
Awami League General Secretary Obaidul Quader has said his party has tasked two of its leaders to probe the matter. 
However, he also confirmed the sacking of the mayor from the party. 
In his own reactions to bdnews24.com, the mayor said, "When they (Bijoy's men who had mounted an attack on his house) opened fire, I also shot a blank round to bring things under control." 
Shahzadpur Municipality BCL Joint Convenor Faisal Islam Setu told bdnews24.com the mayor's brother 'Mintu' and then the mayor himself came out of the house carrying a shotgun when police clubbed the BCL protesters. 
"Three of them were carrying firearms and the others sticks," he added. 
When bdnews24.com tried to contact the mayor again after getting the video, the mobile-phone calls were being diverted.
